dishes.name: Beef Tehari
dishes.description: Beef Tehari is a flavorful rice dish popular in Bangladesh and some regions of India. It is made with aromatic spices, tender beef, and fragrant Basmati rice.
instructions: Wash and soak Basmati rice in water for 30 minutes.
In a pressure cooker, heat ghee or oil and add sliced onions. Fry until they turn golden brown.
Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add beef and fry until browned on all sides.
Add cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cinnamon powder, cardamom pods, bay leaves, and salt. Fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add soaked rice and fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add 4 cups of water and pressure cook for 10-15 minutes or until the rice and beef are cooked through.
Remove from heat and let the pressure release naturally.
Serve hot with raita and salad.

dishes.name: Dhakaiya Chicken Roast
dishes.description: Dhakaiya Chicken Roast is a classic Bangladeshi dish made with marinated chicken roasted in an oven or grill.
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, salt, and all the spices for at least 2-3 hours.
Preheat the oven to 375째F (190째C).
In a pan, heat oil or ghee and fry chopped onions until they turn translucent.
Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add marinated chicken and fry until browned on all sides.
Transfer the chicken to a baking tray and roast in the oven for 45-50 minutes or until fully cooked.
Remove from the oven and let it cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

dishes.name: Shorshe Ilish
dishes.description: Shorshe Ilish is a popular Bengali dish made with Hilsa fish in a mustard gravy. It is a delicacy in Bangladesh and some regions of India.
instructions: Grind yellow and black mustard seeds and green chilies into a fine paste.
Mix the mustard paste with turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt.
Coat the Hilsa fish steaks with the mustard paste and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the marinated fish steaks until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

dishes.name: Mutton Curry
dishes.description: Mutton Curry is a classic Indian and South Asian dish made with tender mutton meat cooked in a flavorful curry sauce.
instructions: In a pressure cooker, heat oil or ghee and fry chopped onions until they turn golden brown.
Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add mutton pieces and fry until browned on all sides.
Add cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, bay leaves, and salt. Fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.
Add 2 cups of water and pressure cook for 15-20 minutes or until the mutton is cooked through.
Remove from heat and let the pressure release naturally.
Serve hot with steamed rice or Indian bread.
